content: Does anyone here have experience with developing a Pantheon Backdrop site locally using Lando?
I have a good bit of experience with Lando, but none whatsoever with Pantheon... I hit a snag trying to pull the DB from Pantheon into Lando, and am hoping maybe someone can help...
Unless I'm mistaken, @jenlampton works with Pantheon.
Yes, but not Lando. This is actually a site I'm working on with her :smile:
That's why I'm using Pantheon forthe first time.
Is there a handy lando-sync command to grab the db @BWPanda ? I usually grab it from the UI of the pantheon dashboard myself, or use drush sql-sync commands (with aliases)
though, I don't know if I've tried the drush command on a backdrop site...
@jenlampton Yep: lando pull - pulls down the DB, files and/or code: https://docs.lando.dev/config/pantheon.html#importing-your-database-and-files

I was trying it last week and was getting an error re. the DB:

Pulling your database... This miiiiight take a minute
 [warning] This environment is in read-only Git mode. If you want to make changes to the codebase of this site (e.g. updating modules or plugins), you will need to toggle into read/write SFTP mode first.
Unable to load class Drush\Sql\Sql                                   [error]   ]
Drush\Sql\SqlException: Unable to find a matching SQL Class. Drush   [error]
cannot find your database connection details. in
/opt/pantheon/drush/commands/sql/sql.drush.inc:577

Because Drush is involved, I'm working whether it's something to do with Backdrop's Drush extension (missing or otherwise not compatible)...?

@BWPanda, ironically (taking into attention I promised AltaGrade will contribute all the database-related functions to Bee soon), brush does remote connections easily. I'm currently working with https://in.backdrop.org and when I need to sync the DB I just brush -y sql-sync @prod @dev. So if you really need to do it regularly via CLI then use brush for now. But as I told database commands for Bee coming soon...
I think the drush extension is missing something
